page.title: 07Local History/Housing-Wetton
page.content: Thor's Cave was examined by Carrington who was a school teacher. It was the home of prehistoric man. They have also found things in other caves, such as Ossom's Cave. Wetton means Wet Hill. There is a church graveyard and the church was rebuilt in 1820. There is an external staircase. There are stone walls round the fields, and very few hedges. There is a lime pit up at the top of Wetton Low. Wakes week is going to be revived after many years. There is a siren in 'Ye Olde Oak Tree' pub. {Housing} The majority of houses are built of limestone with the rest being of gritstone. They range from very plain to very decorative, some being very large and others being very small. Some roofs are stone, but blue slates are most common around Wetton.
